title: Challenger "Inting" Bans, what happened
body:
There were couple people supposedly challenger made a post about how they got banned for 30 days yesterday I think.  I can't find that post anymore so I'm wondering if something transpired while I went out to refill my salt. 

I was quite curious about it because it was very suspicious and that got me thinking:

You guys know those people that got boosted to plat or even diamond by someone who does it seemingly effortlessly? (A few were caught red-handed on this forum not too long ago) Here is my thought, what kind of player can boost someone else to such height? and then it hit me; Challengers. 

There is less incentive for pros since they have a team and most likely sponsors, that leaves us with one tier left; Challengers. 

lol, my 2 cent conspiracy theory with a sprinkle of fresh salt.

replies.body:
Red post that it was supposedly a ban for wintrading and having his account piloted. OP was claiming that it wasn't, and I'm really not sure who to believe in this case.

Unfortunately, either Riot or OP deleted the thread, and no further thread has been created by the OP. Likely we'll never know the truth of what happened, though I'd say it appears more likely (though far from certain) that OP was in fact wintrading and deleted the thread when caught. Though the fact that OP continued replying before the thread was deleted is some evidence to the contrary of that.

Red does more harm than good by deleting a thread like that. There not above admitting mistakes. 

I think the much more likely narrative is that the OP deleted in shame.

Yeah, I do agree that's more likely.

That said, I've only ever seen one instance of Riot admitting a mistake. All other times they've changed their standards to make their mistake no longer a mistake rather than admit it. Riot really hasn't done a whole lot to create trust in my eyes.

Ah like extending Honor 2 cutoff to February.

At least I know I didn't technically cheat the ranked reward system since support said my progress is healthy and I'll be back on NA in December. Lots of time to get from checkpoint 3 to Honor 2.
